result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Julius Dominique Turner

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Julius Dominique Turner appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Julius Dominique Turner.  Attorney Tristan Bednarek appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Julius Dominique Turner not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Julius Dominique Turner.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Julius Dominique Turner not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Julius Dominique Turner.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with E.W., E.D.W., the victim's residence, workplace, or anywhere else she even temporarily occupies.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Julius Dominique Turner in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Julius Dominique Turner in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
 This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Julius Dominique Turner
Current: 7057 N 55th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53223   (Effective: 08-02-2022)
Prior: 9000 West Lynx Avenue, #17, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
